Hello,  Recently purchased a sword which was in a closet wrapped in a 
blan=
ket for the last 60+ years.  It has a Shin gunto tsuka and a older 
appeari=
ng Kyo-sukashi tsuba.  The blade is a bit "rough" but still has 
very visib=
le hada.  The hamon appears to be Suguha for the most part.
The hada is ver=
y prominant, it seems to be a Itame/Mokume mix with 
Masame near the ha.  T=
he Masame hada also can be clearly seen through 
the kissaki.  The sword is=
 unsigned with a osujikai yasurime. The 
nakago condition appears ( a guess=
 ) approx. 1800-1860.  I'm thinking 
a late Edo copy of an Koto Yamato.  Na=
gasa 65cm, machi width 3.1 cm, 
yokote 2.1 cm, sori 1.5 cm.  Do these chara=
cteristics suggest to 
anyone a particular Shinshinto School, Smith or Prov=
ince. I know it 
would be difficult with or without blade in hand, but any =
advice or 
information would be appreciated.   Thanks.....
